com.buyanova.service

Interface UserService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UserServiceImpl

    public interface UserService
    UserService interface is used to describe business logic concerning User entity.
    See Also:
    UserServiceImpl

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeEmail(User user, java.lang.String email)
      Updates user's email in the data source.
      void changeLogin(User user, java.lang.String newLogin)
      Updates user's login in the data source.
      void changeName(User user, java.lang.String name)
      Updates user's name in the data source.
      void changePassword(User user, java.lang.String newPassword)
      Updates user's password in the data source.
      User logIn(User user)
      Allows user to use the application if their login and password match the ones in the data source, otherwise an exception is thrown.
      void removeUser(User user)
      Removes user from the list of active users.
      void replenishAccount(User user, java.math.BigDecimal replenishmentSum)
      Updates user's balance by the specified sum in the data source.
      void signUp(User user)
      Adds new user to the data source.

    • Method Detail

      • signUp

        void signUp(User user)
     throws ServiceException
        Adds new user to the data source.

        By default user's initial balance is set to be zero.

        Note: user's password should be encrypted by all implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        user - user that is to be added
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user is passed, if user contains invalid fields, if login is not unique, if a data source access error occurs

      • logIn

        User logIn(User user)
    throws ServiceException
        Allows user to use the application if their login and password match the ones in the data source, otherwise an exception is thrown.

        Note: user's password should be encrypted by all implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        user - user whose login and password should be used to log in
        Returns:
        user with the information from the data source
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user is passed, if user contains invalid fields, if user with such login and password doesn't exist if a data source access error occurs

      • removeUser

        void removeUser(User user)
         throws ServiceException
        Removes user from the list of active users.
        Parameters:
        user - user that is to be removed
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user is passed, if a data source access error occurs

      • changeLogin

        void changeLogin(User user,
                 java.lang.String newLogin)
          throws ServiceException
        Updates user's login in the data source.
        Parameters:
        user - user whose login is to be updated
        newLogin - new user's login
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user or login is passed, if invalid login is passed, if new login is not unique, if a data source access error occurs

      • changePassword

        void changePassword(User user,
                    java.lang.String newPassword)
             throws ServiceException
        Updates user's password in the data source.

        Note: user's password should be encrypted by all implementations of this method.

        Parameters:
        user - user whose password is to be updated
        newPassword - new user's password
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user or password is passed, if invalid password is passed, if user with their login and old password is not found, if a data source access error occurs

      • changeName

        void changeName(User user,
                java.lang.String name)
         throws ServiceException
        Updates user's name in the data source.
        Parameters:
        user - user whose name is to be updated
        name - new user's name
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user or name is passed, if invalid name is passed, if a data source access error occurs

      • changeEmail

        void changeEmail(User user,
                 java.lang.String email)
          throws ServiceException
        Updates user's email in the data source.
        Parameters:
        user - user whose email is to be updated
        email - new user's email
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user or email is passed, if invalid email is passed, if a data source access error occurs

      • replenishAccount

        void replenishAccount(User user,
                      java.math.BigDecimal replenishmentSum)
               throws ServiceException
        Updates user's balance by the specified sum in the data source.

        Note: the sum should always be positive.

        Parameters:
        user - user whose balance is to be updated
        replenishmentSum - amount of money to add to user's balance
        Throws:
        ServiceException - if null user or sum is passed, if non-positive sum is passed, if a data source access error occurs
